items.title: Taking JavaScript into Python
items.content:
#‚Äã650 ‚Äî August 3, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

A Tale of Evading JavaScript Anti-Debugging Techniques ‚Äî When you‚Äôre poking arounddebugging code written and distributed by a third party, there might be some sneaky traps thrown in your path to prevent your usual techniques from working. What next? Disable breakpoints in DevTools? Use a proxy? What about.. recompiling your entire browser? üòÜ

Veritas

This reminds me of the guy who scraped pages by dumping heap snapshots from the browser ‚Äì another fun post if you enjoy low level spelunking.

VanJS 1.0: A 1KB Reactive UI Framework Without React/JSX ‚Äî VanJS is particularly light and elegant, and its author has put some serious effort into documenting it and offering tools to convert your HTML to its custom format. This week‚Äôs v1.0 release is a relatively big step forward for what is still a young project. GitHub¬†repo.

Tao Xin

Add Excel-Like Spreadsheet Features to Your JavaScript Apps: SpreadJS ‚Äî SpreadJS is the industry-leading JavaScript spreadsheet for adding advanced spreadsheet features to your enterprise apps. Build finance, analysis, budget, and other apps. Excel I/O, 500+ calc functions, tables, charts, and more. View demos¬†now.

SpreadJS from GrapeCity sponsor

PythonMonkey: JavaScript/WASM Interop for Python ‚Äî The alpha release of a new way to bring Python and JavaScript together, by way of embedding Mozilla SpiderMonkey into the Python VM. This post introduces the concept with some examples, an idea of where the project is headed, as well as some Colab¬†demos. GitHub repo.

Will Pringle

dnt: A Tool to Publish a Hybrid npm Module for ESM and CommonJS ‚Äî From the Deno team comes a tool that lets you write modules in JavaScript or TypeScript and then transforms them to support CommonJS, ESM, browsers, Deno, Node, and¬†more.

Andy Jiang (Deno)

‚ö°Ô∏è IN BRIEF:

  • üéß The popular Syntax.fm podcast has had a run of interesting episodes lately covering topics like the idea of ‚ñ∂Ô∏è server-side JavaScript standards, ‚ñ∂Ô∏è Rust for JavaScript developers, and ‚ñ∂Ô∏è the role of polyfills.

  • A social engineering campaign that targets tech employees has been spreading through npm malware, claims Feross Aboukhadijeh of Socket.

  • Radix UI is now available in Vue thanks to Radix Vue.

  • Google has unveiled some big improvements to how the Google Maps JavaScript code can be loaded.

  • Firefox 116's DevTools now support Custom Object formatters. This feature, long supported by Chrome, lets sites determine how certain types of object representation are formatted in the console and¬†debugger.

  • The Svelte project has posted its latest monthly update. There's a lot going on in the Svelte world right now.

Logging and Tracing Re-invented. Stop Sampling, Get Axiom ‚Äî
‚ÄúIn the beginning there was stdout‚Ä¶.‚Äù Get started for free, or get 1tb for¬†$25/mo.

Axiom sponsor

üéâ RELEASES:

  • Backbone 1.5 ‚Äì Yes. Really. And it's still a thing of beauty.

  • Shoelace 2.6 ‚Äì Popular suite of agnostic UI Web Components.

  • Prisma 5.1 ‚Äì Next-gen Node.js + TypeScript ORM.

  • eslint-config-prettier 8.10 ‚Äì Turn off ESLint rules that clash with Prettier.

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

Understanding React Server Components ‚Äî If you‚Äôve struggled to get your head around the ideas involved, and Dan Abramov‚Äôs ‚Äòlet‚Äôs recreate RSCs from scratch‚Äô went too deep, this is a good, high-level explanation of the fundamentals covering what problems RSCs solve, why you might use them, and how Next.js makes it all¬†easier.

Alice Moore (Vercel)

Type vs Interface: Which Should You Use in 2023? ‚Äî Learn the key differences between interfaces and type aliases in TypeScript, including their use cases and important features to¬†consider.

Matt Pocock

How to Build a Multilanguage Website with Next.js & Storyblok

Storyblok sponsor

Speeding Up V8 Heap Snapshots ‚Äî When diagnosing a memory leak in a JavaScript app, engineers at Bloomberg encountered some weird performance issues with capturing a single full-size heapshot taking more than 30 minutes(!) at times. Here‚Äôs the full story of how they investigated and resolved the¬†problem.

Jos√© Dapena Paz (Igalia)

'If Web Components Are So Great, Why Am I Not Using Them?' ‚Äî Do Web Components have a marketing problem? Dave thinks so, and shares what he thinks the issues are for this slowly-adopted¬†technology.

Dave Rupert

‚ñ∂¬†¬†How to Build a Drag-and-Drop Kanban Board ‚Äî A complete screencast walkthrough of using React to build a Trello-like app based around the familiar Kanban board pattern. It also serves as an introduction to the dnd-kit drag-and-drop¬†toolkit.

Kliton Bare

An Introduction to Quicksort ‚Äî A good, beginner friendly introduction to the Quicksort algorithm, concluding with a JavaScript implementation. (Beware the floating burger¬†though..)

Kirupa Chinnathambi

Everything Mux Learnt Migrating 50K Lines of Code to React Server¬†Components
Darius Cepulis (Mux)

‚ñ∂¬†¬†Refactoring an Angular App to Modern NgRx ‚Äî NgRx is a reactive state management approach for Angular.
Marko Stanimirovic

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

tsup 7.2: Bundle Your TypeScript Library with No Config ‚Äî Throw your .js, .json, .mjs, .ts, and .tsx files at the esbuild-powered tsup and say hello to transpiled, bundled code for distribution. More in this¬†tutorial.

egoist

Vite React Boilerplate: A Production Ready Starter Template ‚Äî A new ‚Äòbatteries included‚Äô Vite + React app template that leans upon, well, a lot of batteries from Zustand to Zod to¬†Storybook.

Ricardo Valdovinos

Add Authorization, MFA, Biometrics and More to Your JavaScript App in Just Minutes ‚Äî It's about time that somebody talked some sense about OAuth and JavaScript. So we did. You're¬†welcome.

FusionAuth sponsor

Hackathon Starter 8.0: A Boilerplate for Node Web Apps ‚Äî For when you might want to start building a Node app quickly (like at a hackathon, say) including key features like auth/OAuth, Bootstrap 5, account management, email¬†forms..

Sahat Yalkabov

OGL 1.0: A Minimal WebGL Framework ‚Äî WebGL is far from the easiest technology to use on its own, so libraries like Three.js are often used to make it more accessible. OGL has a similar motive to Three.js while remaining far closer to the WebGL¬†metal.

Nathan Gordon et al.

üíª Jobs

Senior Software Engineer (Frontend Lead) ‚Äî Come lead Emerge's web platform, used by teams like DoorDash, Square, Dropbox & Airbnb (our stack: Next.js, React, TS,¬†Vercel).
üõ∏ Emerge Tools

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profile¬†now.
Hired

üßë‚Äçüíª Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

Size Limit 8.2: JavaScript Performance Budgeting Tool ‚Äî Calculate the real ‚Äòcost‚Äô to run your JS app or lib and maintain an eye on performance and raise the alarm (in your CI system, say) when things go awry. Supports ES modules and tree¬†shaking.

Andrey Sitnik

  • Stockfish.js 16 ‚Äì The famous Stockfish chess engine in JS via WASM.

  • Marked 6.0 ‚Äì Fast Markdown parser and compiler. Now rewritten in TypeScript.

  • eta (Œ∑) 3.1 ‚Äì Embedded JS template engine. Now with Bun support.

  • Tremor 3.6 ‚Äì React library for building dashboards.

  • Octokit.js 3.1 ‚Äì 'Batteries-included' GitHub SDK.

  • React Image Gallery 1.3 ‚Äì Image gallery carousel component.

  • YouTube.js 5.8 ‚Äì Library to use YouTube's private API.

üê¥¬†Let's hit the Oregon Trail

The Oregon Trail was a 2000+ mile wagon route used by traders and migrants headed west in the early days of the United States. It was also a hugely popular computer game that, more often than not, ended in disaster for the virtual settlers whose lives you directed.

Particularly popular on the Apple II and early Macs, you can give the game a spin via the following project:

Macintosh.js: A Virtual Macintosh Running via Electron ‚Äî An impressive virtual machine emulating a 1991 Macintosh Quadra 900 with System 8, all running in Electron. We linked to this several years ago but it‚Äôs had some updates since then and runs faster than before. As well as a few games, such as Oregon Trail, there are a variety of apps pre-installed, including a trial of Adobe Photoshop 3 which starts up faster than my real Photoshop¬†now.. (Download necessary since it's an Electron app and all..)

Felix Rieseberg, Apple, et al.

items.title: Name mangling
items.content:
#‚Äã649 ‚Äî July 27, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Hono + Htmx + Cloudflare: A New Stack? ‚Äî A lot of people seem to be jumping on htmx lately as an alternative to the complexity of frameworks like React, but what if you want to keep using JSX? Hono is a (vaguely Express-like) Web framework targeting edge function use cases and includes middleware for rendering JSX. Yusuke gives a quick example of how all this can come together with Cloudflare Workers and D1 for a simpler, full-stack JS¬†experience.

Yusuke Wada

Shrinking VS Code with Name Mangling ‚Äî There‚Äôs a fair bit of JavaScript in VS Code but the team has managed to reduce the size of the shipped code by almost 4MB without actually doing any deleting or refactoring thanks to a new ‚Äòname mangling‚Äô build step. This is a great read on how the team approached things and got it¬†working.

Matt Bierner

New Course: The Hard Parts of UI Development ‚Äî Develop an under-the-hood knowledge of UI development by learning techniques such as data binding, UI composition, templating, virtual DOM and its reconciliation, and hooks, all from¬†scratch!

Frontend Masters sponsor

Microsoft TypeChat: An Approach for Type-Safe LLM Responses ‚Äî A new project with some prominent names attached (the designer of C# and PM for TypeScript, for starters) that demonstrates the excitement within MS for large language models (LLMs). TypeChat aims to work around the problem of LLMs outputting hard-to-parse natural language and to direct such output into a predictable, typed form.

Hejlsberg, Lucco, Rosenwasser et al.

‚ö°Ô∏è IN BRIEF:

  • üê¶ React/Redux's Dan Abramov is leaving Meta. Having achieved so much and reaching a point where he feels ready to move on, Dan is departing Meta but will remain on the React team as an independent third¬†party.¬†üíô

  • üìò The Concise TypeScript Book is, unsurprisingly, a guide to using TypeScript. More surprisingly, it's all on GitHub and free to read. Hurrah.

  • Tixy is an interactive page for learning logic, math and expressions by solving puzzles using a visual grid. It starts off very simply, but gets elaborate quickly. This is a neat way to pick up some of the skills needed for¬†Dwitter.

  • JSPlayground is a new Web-based JavaScript sandbox tool.

  • Is the term 'Jamstack' finished? Brian Rinaldi wonders.

üéâ RELEASES:

  • Bun 0.7 ‚Äì The JavaScriptCore-based alternative JS runtime adds (experimental) Vite support, Web Workers support, and includes a --smol option to run in memory constrained environments (with a significant memory reduction shown off in the¬†post).

  • Astro 2.9 ‚Äì The 'zero JS by default' framework adds experimental support for view transitions and more.

  • Neutralinojs v4.13.0 ‚Äì Lightweight cross-platform desktop app framework.

  • Remix 1.19 ‚Äì Modern full-stack JS framework.

  • Node.js v20.5.0 (Current)

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

üíõ ¬†'Good Code is Like a Love Letter to The Next Developer Who Will Maintain¬†It' ‚Äî ‚ÄúThe beauty of our creations, however, is not judged solely by the elegance of our algorithms or the efficiency of our code, but by the joy and ease with which others can build upon our¬†work.‚Äù

Addy Osmani

More practically, Addy also tells us to stick to 'boring architecture' for as long as possible.

üìÖ ¬†React Native EU Conf with Guenther Steiner: Book Last¬†Regular¬†Tickets

Callstack sponsor

How to Build a GPT-3 App with Next.js, React, and GitHub Copilot ‚Äî GitHub doesn't often run tutorials on its blog, but they appear keen to promote the idea of a modern Copilot-oriented development¬†process, and this certainly shows off some of the¬†potential.

Kedasha Kerr (GitHub)

Upgrading an Ancient React App
Jeffrey Carl Faden

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

a11y-dialog 8.0: A Lightweight, Accessible Way to Create Dialogs ‚Äî Supports alert dialogs as per WAI-ARIA, nested dialogs, and provides both a DOM and JavaScript API. There‚Äôs a live CodeSandbox demo you can play¬†with. v8.0 no longer supports IE, if that's important to¬†you.

Kitty Giraudel

Mapkick.js: Interactive Maps in One Line of JavaScript ‚Äî Supports Mapbox and MapLibre. It also comes in Python and Ruby variants targeting server-side rendered use¬†cases.

Andrew Kane

RxDB - Local Database For JavaScript Applications ‚Äî With RxDB you can build realtime applications with great performance that even works when your users are¬†offline.

RxDB sponsor

PLJS: JavaScript Language Plugin for Postgres ‚Äî PLV8 is the ‚Äògo to‚Äô extension to use JavaScript within Postgres, but this QuickJS-based variant, from the same creator, is more compact, easier to maintain, and may be enough for¬†your¬†needs.

Jerry Sievert

Twin 3.4: Use Tailwind Classes in CSS-in-JS Libraries ‚Äî Twin v3 introduced full Tailwind plugin support, and v3.4 adds a new SolidJS preset as well as styled-components 6¬†support.

Ben Rogerson

Praxis: An iOS Browser That Blocks JavaScript ‚Äî Well, that‚Äôs certainly one way to fight back against prompts, modals, and battery sapping scripts, but it won‚Äôt work with every¬†site..

Arnold Sakhnov

Spectacle 10: A React and JSX-Based Presentation Library ‚Äî Got a presentation coming up? Build your decks with JSX, perhaps. GitHub repo.

Formidable

üíª Jobs

Senior Software Engineer (Frontend Lead) ‚Äî Come lead Emerge's web platform, used by teams like DoorDash, Square, Dropbox & Airbnb (our stack: Next.js, React, TS,¬†Vercel).
üõ∏ Emerge Tools

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profile¬†now.
Hired

üßë‚Äçüíª Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

  • gridstack.js 8.4
    ‚Ü≥ Framework agnostic dashboard layout and creation.

  • amqp-client.js 3.0
    ‚Ü≥ AMQP 0-9-1 client for both Node and browser (via WebSocket).

  • FingerprintJS 4.0
    ‚Ü≥ Browser fingerprinting library. No longer open source.

  • MQTT.js 5.0 ‚Äì MQTT client for Node and browser.

üôà¬†Taking things too far..

We'll support anyone who's keen to reduce the amount of needless JavaScript that goes over the wire (üëã Astro or Qwik) but sometimes, just sometimes, you can go too far with the endeavor to almost comedic effect:

üò± ¬†Implementing Tic Tac Toe with 170MB of HTML ‚Äî Unsurprisingly, the demo (which we‚Äôve not linked to here) brought my browser to a crashing halt, but it‚Äôs fun to see a developer take on the challenge of using Chrome‚Äôs support for popovers and the state of said popovers along with a huge pile of HTML to handle a game of Tic Tac Toe. Don‚Äôt repeat this in production,¬†folks..

Gareth Heyes

üìÖ ¬†React Native EU Conf with Guenther Steiner: Book Last¬†Regular¬†Tickets
Callstack sponsor


  
  
How to Build a GPT-3 App with Next.js, React, and GitHub Copilot ‚Äî GitHub doesn't often run tutorials on its blog, but they appear keen to promote the idea of a modern Copilot-oriented development¬†process, and this certainly shows off some of the¬†potential.
Kedasha Kerr (GitHub) 


  
Upgrading an Ancient React App
  
Jeffrey Carl Faden 
  


üõ†¬†Code & Tools 




  





  
  
a11y-dialog 8.0: A Lightweight, Accessible Way to Create Dialogs ‚Äî Supports alert dialogs as per WAI-ARIA, nested dialogs, and provides both a DOM and JavaScript API. There‚Äôs a live CodeSandbox demo you can play¬†with. v8.0 no longer supports IE, if that's important to¬†you.
Kitty Giraudel 


  
  
Mapkick.js: Interactive Maps in One Line of JavaScript ‚Äî Supports Mapbox and MapLibre. It also comes in Python and Ruby variants targeting server-side rendered use¬†cases.
Andrew Kane 


  
  
RxDB - Local Database For JavaScript Applications ‚Äî With RxDB you can build realtime applications with great performance that even works when your users are¬†offline.
RxDB sponsor


  
  
PLJS: JavaScript Language Plugin for Postgres ‚Äî PLV8 is the ‚Äògo to‚Äô extension to use JavaScript within Postgres, but this QuickJS-based variant, from the same creator, is more compact, easier to maintain, and may be enough for¬†your¬†needs.
Jerry Sievert 


  
  
Twin 3.4: Use Tailwind Classes in CSS-in-JS Libraries ‚Äî Twin v3 introduced full Tailwind plugin support, and v3.4 adds a new SolidJS preset as well as styled-components 6¬†support.
Ben Rogerson 


  
  
Praxis: An iOS Browser That Blocks JavaScript ‚Äî Well, that‚Äôs certainly one way to fight back against prompts, modals, and battery sapping scripts, but it won‚Äôt work with every¬†site..
Arnold Sakhnov 


  
  
Spectacle 10: A React and JSX-Based Presentation Library ‚Äî Got a presentation coming up? Build your decks with JSX, perhaps. GitHub repo.
Formidable 





üíª Jobs





  
Senior Software Engineer (Frontend Lead) ‚Äî Come lead Emerge's web platform, used by teams like DoorDash, Square, Dropbox & Airbnb (our stack: Next.js, React, TS,¬†Vercel).
  
üõ∏ Emerge Tools 
  


  
Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profile¬†now.
  
Hired 
  


üßë‚Äçüíª Got a job listing to share? Here's how.














gridstack.js 8.4
amqp-client.js 3.0
FingerprintJS 4.0
MQTT.js 5.0 ‚Äì MQTT client for Node and browser.


üôà¬†Taking things too far..




We'll support anyone who's keen to reduce the amount of needless JavaScript that goes over the wire (üëã Astro or Qwik) but sometimes, just sometimes, you can go too far with the endeavor to almost comedic effect:


  





  
  
üò± ¬†Implementing Tic Tac Toe with 170MB of HTML ‚Äî Unsurprisingly, the demo (which we‚Äôve not linked to here) brought my browser to a crashing halt, but it‚Äôs fun to see a developer take on the challenge of using Chrome‚Äôs support for popovers and the state of said popovers along with a huge pile of HTML to handle a game of Tic Tac Toe. Don‚Äôt repeat this in production,¬†folks..
Gareth Heyes

items.title: The tale of how static typing came to JavaScript
items.content:
#‚Äã648 ‚Äî July 20, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

pkg-size: Find the True, Current Size of an npm Package Without Leaving Your Browser ‚Äî A beautifully designed site that can show you the true size of an npm package (including dependencies) using the actual packages which are 'installed' in a browser-based WebContainers-powered environment. Hiroki has üê¶ a Twitter thread where he explains more about how it¬†works.

Hiroki Osame

TypeScript and the Dawn of Gradual Types ‚Äî From GitHub‚Äôs ReadME project comes a thorough journalistic take on how static typing made it into the JavaScript world, what TypeScript offers, some alternative approaches, and the possibility of adding type annotations to JavaScript¬†iself.

Mike Melanson (GitHub)

Create a Real-Time Multi-Host Livestream with Amazon IVS ‚Äî Amazon Interactive Video Service (Amazon IVS) enables developers to create dynamic video experiences, such as collaborative livestreams with multiple hosts. Click here to learn¬†more.

Amazon Web Services (AWS) sponsor

Storybook 7.1: The Workshop for Building UI Components ‚Äî v7.1 introduces in-app onboarding for your newest team members, zero-config styling support for Tailwind, MUI, styled-components and MUI, Vue 3 source snippets, and¬†more.

Storybook Team

Five Inconvenient Truths about TypeScript ‚Äî A brief dose of reality for a world seemingly obsessed with TypeScript: ‚ÄúIf you want to get into TypeScript, don‚Äôt think you can leave JavaScript behind. It will find you, and it will get¬†you.‚Äù

Stefan Baumgartner

üéâ RELEASES:

  • Fresh 1.3 ‚Äì The Deno web framework. Plugins can now inject routes and middleware into apps, there's Deno.serve support, and you can create async route components.

  • Downshift 8.0 ‚Äì Primitives to build WAI-ARIA compliant React autocomplete, combobox & select components.

  • Node.js v18.17.0 (LTS) ‚Äì Node 18 gets the Ada 2.0 WHATWG URL parser.

  • Fastify 4.20 ‚Äì The fast, low overhead web Node.js framework.

‚ö°Ô∏è IN BRIEF:

  • The Promise.withResolvers proposal has progressed from stage 2 to 3 at TC39, as has the array grouping proposal, as well as source phase¬†imports.

  • üó£ The folks on Hacker News discussed why the site isn't being indundated with links to new JavaScript frameworks recently. Has React 'won'? Has AI stolen the limelight? Or is a JavaScript revolution quietly¬†brewing..?

  • üë¥üèª A blog post from 1996 popped up telling us about the newest JavaScript features in Netscape 3.0 ‚Äì definitely a blast from the past. Say hello to the typeof operator!

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

'How We Generate JS and Python SDKs from a Canonical Rust¬†SDK' ‚Äî PostgresML is an extension that adds machine learning functions into Postgres. Its team loves and prefers Rust but most of its users are using JavaScript or Python. What to do? Simultaneously write multi-language libraries using¬†Rust..

Silas Marvin (PostgresML)

üí° Psst.. if you use Postgres at all, we have a Postgres newsletter¬†too!

Updating Code with jscodeshift ‚Äî TypeORM is an ORM for Node that introduced some breaking changes requiring the author to update lots of calls in his code. A perfect time to use a ‚Äòcodemod‚Äô to automate the job. Even if you don‚Äôt use TypeORM, this post might give you some ideas for other places to use such an¬†approach.

Clinton Blackburn

AI-Proofing Your Career For Tomorrow: Free Session by Interview¬†Kickstart ‚Äî Discover Your AI Career Path (AI/ML vs Data Science). Take an informed decision: Insights from FAANG+ AI/ML Engineers. Register for a free¬†session.

Interview Kickstart sponsor

How React 18 Improves App Performance ‚Äî If you‚Äôve not entirely kept up with how things have changed or developed in React with regards to concurrent rendering, transitions, Suspense, and even React Server Components, this is a fantastic review and primer to get up to speed on how React's newer features dramatically help with¬†performance.

Lydia Hallie (Vercel)

300ms Faster: Measures Taken to Reduce Wikipedia's Total Blocking Time (TBT)
Nicholas Ray

On the Origins of JSX and Why It Exists
Hristiyan Dodov

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

wavesurfer.js 7: Audio Waveform Player ‚Äî If you‚Äôre creating a podcast player, audio experience, or anything where seeing an interactive audio waveform could be useful, check this out. GitHub¬†repo.

katspaugh and contributors

TOAST UI Grid: A Customizable Grid Control for the Web ‚Äî A powerful MIT-licensed grid-style control for the display, editing, and management of data. It comes from the same folks as TUI Editor and TUI Calendar and while it‚Äôs happy on its own, there are wrappers for Vue and React too. GitHub¬†repo.

NHN

Breakpoints and console.log is the Past, Time Travel is the¬†Future ‚Äî 15x faster JavaScript debugging than with breakpoints and console.log, supports Vitest, jest, karma, jasmine, and¬†more.

Wallaby.js sponsor

Pines: A Library of UI Components for Alpine.js and Tailwind¬†Projects ‚Äî Includes sliders, tooltips, accordions, modals, and others. The CSS-only components are usable in any Tailwind project while the ones that require JS are designed for use with¬†Alpine.js.

devdojo

YouTube.js 5.5: A Wrapper Around YouTube's Private API ‚Äî One of those things you'd expect to be quickly blocked somehow, but it's 18 months old, so... üòÜ The fun isn't just for Node or Deno users ‚Äì it'll work in the browser if you can proxy the requests through your own¬†server.

LuanRT

Eruda 3.0: A Console for Mobile Browsers ‚Äî If you‚Äôre in a situation where you have no access to DevTools, you can add Eruda to your page and it provides a sort of virtual devtools you can use from any browser, including on¬†mobile.

LiriLiri

Reagraph 4.10: WebGL Graph Visualization Library for¬†React ‚Äî Here‚Äôs a basic code example. This week‚Äôs release adds support for three dimensional clustering. GitHub¬†repo.

REAGRAPH

brotli-wasm 2.0: A Brotli Compressor and Decompressor ‚Äî Covers both Node and the browser by means of¬†WebAssembly.

HTTP Toolkit

Pacquet: A New, Experimental Package Manager for Node ‚Äî From a Node.js core member, no less.

Yagiz Nizipli

  • Shareon 2.2
    ‚Ü≥ Lightweight, stylish 'share' buttons for social networks.

  • Helipopper 8.0
    ‚Ü≥ Tooltips and popovers for Angular. (Demos.)

  • Ink 4.3
    ‚Ü≥ React for interactive command-line apps.

  • üìÖ React Calendar 4.4

  • ‚ôñ React Chessboard 4.0

üíª Jobs

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profile¬†now.
Hired

üßë‚Äçüíª Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

üéµ¬†Thank you for the music..

Chip Player JS: Browser-Based MIDIs, MODs and Game Music ‚Äî The creator of this site has, like me, a fascination with old digital music ‚Äì¬†MIDI files, trackers, and the like. Rather than keep an old computer running, he decided to build a browser based music player for such¬†files.

Matt Montag

P.S. If you're looking for something specific to listen to, the music by famed Norwegian tracker Jogeir Liljedahl is well worth a try ‚Äì particularly Overture or Guitar Slinger. Or how about Donkey Kong Country's dreamy Aquatic Ambience? It's striking how trackers managed to squeeze so much down into a few hundred kilobytes by the heavy reuse and manipulation of samples.

items.title: htmx in 100 seconds
items.content:
#‚Äã647 ‚Äî July 13, 2023

Read on the Web

JavaScript Weekly

Driver.js: Create On-Page Tours, Highlights, and Contextual Help ‚Äî A no-dependency, vanilla JavaScript library for putting together page tours and contextual help systems. The project is a few years old but has just been entirely rewritten and gained numerous enhancements, plus a huge lick of paint. There are lots of examples to check¬†out.

Kamran Ahmed

Component Party: A Rosetta Stone of UI Library Code Examples ‚Äî A comparison of different frameworks (like React, Vue, Svelte, Angular, Ember, etc.) by way of simple code snippets covering various¬†tasks.

Mathieu Schimmerling

Test and Validate APIs Effectively and Efficiently ‚Äî Gain access to several API testing tools and features that help you automate repetitive tasks, stay organized, and build robust workflows to ensure your APIs remain reliable and¬†performant.

Postman sponsor

Prettier 3.0: Now Powered by ES Modules ‚Äî The popular multi-language code formatter gets a big upgrade with a refactoring to ES modules making up the biggest change (though it can still be used as a library via CommonJS). One side effect is Prettier now supports ESM-based plugins and async parsers which means some necessary changes for Prettier plugin¬†developers.

Sosuke Suzuki

Crockford on Plain Old JavaScript and the DOM ‚Äî Over the years, Douglas has asked us to only use the good parts of JavaScript, to ‚ñ∂Ô∏è stop using JavaScript, and now he suggests abandoning ‚Äúthe libraries‚Äù to instead work with the DOM directly. Lea Verou üê¶ picked up on this story and said this suggestion still isn't very practical for most web apps as of¬†2023.

Douglas Crockford

üéâ RELEASES:

  • Ember 5.1 ‚Äì The ambitious JS framework that'll never give up takes a big step into the TypeScript world with stable TypeScript support and types-a-plenty.

  • p5.js 1.7 ‚Äì Processing-inspired JavaScript library for creative coding. v1.7 introduces WebGL 2 and frame buffer support.

  • Prisma 5.0 ‚Äì A popular ORM for Node.js and TypeScript. 5.0 boasts significant performance improvements.

  • typescript-eslint 6.0

‚ö°Ô∏è IN BRIEF:

  • obj?.prop = value; The optional chaining assignment proposal advanced to stage 1 at TC39 this week. (Explanatory slidedeck.)

  • Popular YouTube channel Fireship explains ‚ñ∂Ô∏è htmx in 100 seconds ‚Äì well timed, since htmx is seeing a huge amount of fresh interest. And if you're wondering who the mastermind behind Fireship is, Honeypot has put up ‚ñ∂Ô∏è a short documentary about¬†him.

  • The folks at Sandworm have shared a look at the state of the npm registry including lots of trivia, history, and stats on how many packages there are, as well as the most commonly used keywords in¬†packages.

  • Google shares a case study on performance of scroll-driven animations using its new browser based API versus 'classical JavaScript techniques.' Unsurprisingly it's much faster running away from the main thread, and the spec remains in draft for¬†now.

  • npm will now check the linked source commit and repo when you view a package's provenance information on npmjs.com and warn you when said provenance cannot be established.

  • GitHub is rolling out a beta of passwordless, passkey based authentication on¬†GitHub‚Ä§com.

üìí¬†Articles & Tutorials

Useful Functions for a (Deno) HTTP Server ‚Äî You could think of HTTP in a functional way with requests going in and responses/results going out. The author explores Deno‚Äôs new Deno.serve function and how both it and the /x/http_fns functions can provide a more functional approach to common HTTP¬†tasks.

Jollytoad

Testing the Dark Scenarios of a Node.js App ‚Äî Several examples of often overlooked things you should be testing. What happens when a service times out, code is mutating things it shouldn‚Äôt, or you have zombie processes milling around? These are some of the ‚Äòdark scenarios‚Äô it's not too difficult to prepare¬†for.

Yoni Goldberg and Raz Luvaton

The 2023 State of the API Report Is Here ‚Äî The State of the API is the world's largest survey and report on APIs, with findings from over 40K developers and API¬†professionals.

Postman sponsor

Creating Randomized Zelda: Tears of the Kingdom Patterns ‚Äî Nintendo's new Zelda game uses repeated, geometric patterns as part of its aesthetic. This post looks at how to recreate such motifs with SVG and¬†JavaScript.

Paul Hebert

5 TS Compiler Flags You Should Include in Your Project's Config
Igor Konovalov

Deploying a Fastify and Vue 3 Static Site to Heroku
Liran Tal

Getting Started with Vector Databases in Node.js
Valeri Karpov

üõ†¬†Code & Tools

MDX Editor: A Rich Markdown Editor React Component ‚Äî A Lexical-powered Markdown editor for React apps that supports code blocks, tables, and more. The live demo shows off most of what you need to¬†see.

Petyo Ivanov

Meet Your New Favorite Teammate: Cody, the AI Coding Assistant ‚Äî Code faster with Cody, the only code AI that knows your entire codebase, like the pair programmer you always¬†wanted.

Sourcegraph sponsor

electron-vite: Next Generation Electron Build Tooling ‚Äî Fish and chips, Bert and Ernie.. some things are just better together, and so it goes with the Electron desktop app framework and the Vite frontend toolkit. There‚Äôs also an Electron Vite Boilerplate app to kick off a new app¬†with.

Alex Wei

üìä ¬†Vizzu 0.8: A Library for Animated Data Visualizations ‚Äî Making data visualizations is reasonably easy, but animating them is harder. Vizzu steps in to help you create animated data stories and explorations. There are lots of showcases and examples to¬†peruse.

Vizzu Inc.

üêä ¬†Putout: A Configurable, Babel-Based Linter and Code Transformer ‚Äî Provides typical linting functionality with ESLint and code transformation with Babel, but distinguishes itself by being prepared to make ‚Äúmore drastic code transformations‚Äù than other tools. It‚Äôs not the most popular option but it makes a good case for itself in its thorough¬†README.

coderaiser

Standardized Audio Context: Cross-Browser Web Audio API Wrapper ‚Äî A side effect-free abstraction over a subset of the Web Audio API that works reliably across all mainstream¬†browsers.

Christoph Guttandin

Kanel: Generate TypeScript Types from Postgres ‚Äî It works by inspecting a live database and outputs code you can add to a TypeScript project and use with something like Knex ‚Äì GitHub¬†repo.

Kristian Dupont

React Authentication ‚Äî Without Complexity

Userfront sponsor

  • Boa 0.17 ‚Äì An experimental Javascript lexer, parser and compiler written in Rust that can be embedded into other projects ‚Äì it now has a module system.

  • Octokit.js 3.0
    ‚Ü≥ Official GitHub SDK for browsers, Node, and Deno.

  • Release It! 16.1
    ‚Ü≥ Automate npm package publishing and versioning.

  • zlFetch 6.0
    ‚Ü≥ Convenience wrapper around the Fetch API.

  • Terminalizer 0.10
    ‚Ü≥ Record your terminal and generate animated GIFs.

  • eslint-plugin-prettier 5.0
    ‚Ü≥ Prettier, but as an ESLint rule.

  • Preact 10.16 ‚Äì 3KB React compatible alternative.

üíª Jobs

Find JavaScript Jobs with Hired ‚Äî Hired makes job hunting easy-instead of chasing recruiters, companies approach you with salary details up front. Create a free profile¬†now.
Hired

üßë‚Äçüíª Got a job listing to share? Here's how.

üç©¬†Homer would approve

donut.js: donut.c, But in JavaScript ‚Äî donut.c, dating from 2006, is a donut-shaped C program that, when run, animates a spinning ASCII text donut on the screen. Here‚Äôs a fresh and hot JavaScript¬†variant!

Evan Zhou

Google shares a case study on performance of scroll-driven animations using its new browser based API versus 'classical JavaScript techniques.' Unsurprisingly it's much faster running away from the main thread, and the spec remains in draft for¬†now.
